ZQ_CooXqfgoAT3A_fKyP-A.text: This place was recommended by a friend Rizza the king.  When you first walk in you notice a sleek, sexy high price hooker type of environment.  Very NYC living in London.  Luckily for me I'm a baller.  The great you with a warm towel which is always nice.  The spicy edamame was great (kinda tasted like they just put siracha on it).  Food was ok, I've had cheaper places with better food in LA after a night of drinks, a series of stolen cars and memories.  Do not come here stoned unless you want to really spend money.  The main attraction is the woman.  I've also never seen so many hot chicks with mediocre dudes.  I guess money can buy happiness.  I feel like this is a place someone could be stuntin' at without really spending the real dough.  Yes guys we can have our cake and eat it too.  So the food is not bad, but not memorable.  I had chicken skewers that tasted like I could have got them at a local bar (so they were aight).  You come here for the vibe, sense of the wealth and the eye candy is mm mmm delicious.  Dress kinda nicer, bring some class and get that ass.

photos.caption: Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. Just the food

kj385QP2FCvg8upan8LWMQ.text: Hungry, tired and annoyed at the scene on Oxford, I took a turn on to North Audley and came across Roka. Mario, the super charismatic Italian bartender, greeted me with a huge smile.  After 2 glasses of delicious Seresin "Tatou" Savignon Blanc and the Tuna Tataki app, Mario gave me a taste of an Espresso Martini. Best I've ever had.I will make Roka a destination next time I am in London

9Vzoyg03Y2sMLqxA7hCeog.text: As invincible Joe says "'Mediocre". Service was cac. We got a table for 5:30 pm when the chefs were still having a pep talk and hoo-ha-ing loudly in the next room. They sat us by the toilet door area where people were coming in and out and the servers were using the other door to serve people outside so it was cold. My friend dropped her coat tag on the floor and no one picked it up for 5 minutes. I mean not to sound posh but that's not something you'd expect in a restaurant like thisThe food was dry and distasteful- we had the maki rolls, sashimi, salmon tataki and miso black cod dumplings.  They made amends by taking a few items off our bill but still wouldn't go back - I like my sushi fresh and well composed.  We left feeling sick. The best thing there was the salmon tataki.

mt7lIt0PBnreyQQXJvDARw.text: Tried it and although the place was nicely decorated,  the crowd very stylish and  rich and the food decent... I didn't like it. This place lacks of coziness and the same dishes can be found at few other trendy spots in London. I wasn't impressed or delighted during my time there neither were the wait staff.

bhV25yEQQv-kdb5jr8Dr5w.text: Having been back to london town for a short while again, this was one of the hot new sushi places that popped up that I hadn't tried. Set one of london's expensive areas- Mayfair- you already know it's going to be pricey. The real question is whether or not this place would stand up to its reputation.I usually hate to include service in my reviews, because in my books good food always trumps service. But this place was not up to standard. It was annoying that in this kind of 'up-scale' restaurant the waiters were bringing us food that we hadn't ordered, not once but several times. To add to that even though it was not crowded when I was there there was slow service. I had to mention it because it simply wasn't good enough for the kind of restaurant Roka is trying to compete with.Now for the important bit- the food. Overall their appetisers were good, but nothing special. Their miso soup was average. The actual sushi was fresh... Very very fresh. It was the freshness of all the ingredients  that made it good. I can't really describe that feeling when you take that bite of sushi and the combination tastes is just right, there aren't a lot of place that can do that.This place is known for its "fireside Japanese cooking" and so we had to order so grilled dishes. The steak dish was good but the chicken - although good- was something I feel I could've cooked at home. Overall I think the commotion was over its location, nice interiors, and as you'll see in the photos - nice presentation. Overall this place might be just looks. I would give it a 3.5 because it was lacking in most of the departments except for the sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. Nutty zucchini appetizer - I didn't like it
Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. More sushi
Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. Rock shrimp

QliDyUSNSGxlOIiVzWFFKw.text: This became a London mainstay a decade ago in Charlotte Street, and the branch just off the middle of Oxford Street has cemented its reputation for nouvelle Japanese cuisine. Service is perfectly charming and efficient but the food comes out in the order it wants to. The lamb cutlets were thick and sublime, the fried aubergine a hearty surprise, and the chicken unlike any poultry I'd ever eaten at any Japanese restaurant anywhere - supreme. For desserts, we enjoyed the creme brûlée with Yamazaki ice-cream so much we ordered it twice.The wine and cocktail selection is comprehensive as well as imaginative. This is a pricey place, but it really is special; funkier than Nobu, more upmarket than Sumosan and comparable to Zuma, it really has found its groove in London. delusionaryculinary

gKYN5SXi7nVUibyOsrNikQ.text: Great restaurant at an awesome part on town. Food was very delicious. Service was superb. Great ambiance. The quality of the fish was extra ordinary. Aside from, Sushi/Sashimi, their menu had some great combination of fish and meat dishes. Very pricey but a great place.

DNTi7TZ_J4qtPkGR498IJQ.text: Great service. Not as nice a vibe as Zuma. The food was up to scratch. Very decent ebi tempura.

rnCh5uZc11jghdi6AdxIhQ.text: Everything was good.  I did prefer the hot food over the sushi.  I recommend you have a sandwich before you go, portions are small and you will spend a small fortune.

xwlIbKv1FrSJNaVCkXZ1qQ.text: Service: EXCELLENTFood: EXCELLENT. Best quality of sushi, the Beef was cooked perfectly.We sat at the bar which was perfect actually. Server was very knowledgeable about the food & gave us some great recommendations. Wish they had one in the US!

n9m4TZlprxQ5YQ8k-5hyOQ.text: We had a lovely time. Situated in central London. Close to Main Street Oxford street off of Selfridges but away from the rifraf. Great food, beautiful ambiance and fantastic service !!

photos.caption: Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. Had a lovely time at Roka.

Kg_QYek-rGt2OOPG8BO2PQ.text: The service is the wost! The food is average at best. This is the second time I've been here.. there's gotta be a better japanese restaurant in London.. the problem   gotta be that there are no Japanese people workin here.. Sayonara!

cJnngpP7cvq3K4JWWrrNkQ.text: It seems that this place is quite popular cuz my friend who booked the table only get one for 6pm and anything later is fully booked. This place is close to Selfridges and Bond Street. The restaurant is quite big and it is nicely decorated.  Sushi and sashimi are okay. And they are tiny as well. There isn't much to say cuz I just think they are normal and the salmon are not very fresh I think.Rice hot pot and tofu were really delicious. Grilled vegetables we ordered were nice as well. However we ordered grilled chicken as well and it was overcooked with a lot of burn. It was more than 200 pounds for three of us including drink and I just think it doesn't worse it. The food was just normal.

Qk92QDEDNvAIGN2rNwKkXg.text: A great scene with even better food. Had a great time with help from our favorite Italian waiter Mario. Mario makes it pretty.

photos.caption: Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom

4cvCagfpQVN7wE38dTSsTg.text: Nice environment, good food, small portion. Bit pricey.

photos.caption: Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. Black cod
Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. Baby chicken
Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. Vegetable salad

e9O-ZweF21CbL_c6sX5YiQ.text: The Mayfair is conveniently located being only a few minutes walk from Bond Street tube station and it is close to Selfridges, making it an excellent location to be situated. I was there on a weekday and it was buzzing with people. We were seated at a table located at the back of the restaurant, which made it a bit more private and quiet to enjoy an evening with my friendsWe ordered a selection of dishes to share but the portion are small. I would not recommend to go to Roka if you really hungry because this place can really hurt your piggy bank!Roka is suppose to be special for serving contempoary Japanese robatayaki, so we ordered some dishes under the robata section of the menu. We ordered one portion each - chicken skewers (£8.90) and beef skewers (£15) and for the price we only got two skewers in a portion. There are also non-skewers dishes under the Robata section of the menu and we tried the black cod. It was a nice piece of fish but an expensive piece of fish.There are selections of tempura and fried dishes. We decided we need some vegetable and ordered the tempura vegetable.I did like the gyoza and we ordered both variety that was on the menu.- Gyuniku to goma no gyoza (£7.30) - filled with beef, ginger and sesame dumplings- Gindara to kani no gyoza (£12.90) - filled with black cod, crab and crayfish dumplingsAs well as ordering a variety of hot dishes, we tried some of  the sushi at Roka. We had two plates of sushi with a mix of maki rolls and nigiri. I thought it was nice quality sushi but the size of the nirigi seem to be smaller than what you might get at most Japanaese restaurant.We also ordered the Kani no Kamameshi- rice hot pot with crab and wasabi tobiko. The texture reminded me of congee which is a name for Chinese congee. The portion of the hot pot is not big and probably enough for one or two people. We shared it between eight person as a taster portion and gave us about one or two tablespoons each.Mine and every ones favourite dish had to be the dessert platter. It was actually the one dish I wanted to have in the reason to visit Roka. Variety of dessert served on a boat which made it the best looking dessert I have seen so far, and the most expensive dessert I have had.Roka does serves tasty food but it is expensive. I would only recommend to go over there is you do have the cash to splash, there is any offers (let me know if there is!) or for a special occasion (like me!).

WYL42cYv0-DzWZmQWeguag.text: Excellent service and food for my first meal in London. Favorite dishes was yellowtail apple salad and crab rice pot. Sushi portions are small but tasty

jYnE7qK23rSufAu2I-QDXA.text: Im shocked from over rated rest. I ordered 5 dishes and liked non !!!!!!!!! I've been to all level restaurants in London and we love food  but this one was the worse of food tasting

9A-wmfEg2kdw9g3x3cwWcg.text: Staff was extremely gracious. Food was amazing. Atmosphere is quite good. Top shelf quality. People to match. Thanks for an amazing meal.

vLFf8CjVK9LWGNSTnHwjTg.text: Came for a friends birthday a few months ago, can not fault the food or the service! Had a great evening would definitely recommend

gtfRBaVyNWRk_gQGmCxn2w.text: excellent food, excellent service. not cheap, but that's Mayfair for you. Roka has same owners as Zuma, hence the standards are kept as they should be. Sushi is fantastic. Fish is of amazing quality. Décor is simple  and pretty bright lights. Its a nice place and usually vibrant atmosphere.

2NpPjHK1gzVVkvoklQcf-w.text: One of the best restaurant I had lunch at while visiting London. The dessert platter was everything!!!!!!

ODIhn4KoRxh7oi2acNfF9w.text: If you want expensive sushi then this is the place to eat! Highly popular and undoubtedly exceptional with the price to easily tag along for tapas style portions this place was lively, energetic, and pricey. A plus for me was it was open late in an area that shuts down relatively early. My King Crab rice pot was excellent, flavorful, and filling and the presentation was excellent. I sat at the sushi bar but it really seemed like a kitchen in the middle of the action and it was filled with action with the chefs calling out orders and sous chefs acknowledging them. The presentation of all meals was superb and that should be rated 5 stars . I was anxious to be fed after a long day and my standards were closing. My food was excellent but in my haste I didn't check prices. I'm not sure I was dressed correctly for this trendy spot but I walked in like a king and received good service.

photos.caption: Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. Place setting
Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. Menu options
Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom

kVwidRcSMuQiVouLCcyQVw.text: Roka was one of our favorite meals from our week in London due to the fun and buzzy atmosphere as well as the delicious and inventive food. This would easily be a five star review except our server was a bit too cold and unfriendly, but that didn't detract much from the meal. Most of the items you order are from the robata grill or from the sushi bar and you can't go wrong with selections from either place. Every single item we ordered was fantastic. That's pretty rare especially since we ordered about a dozen items. Food recommendations:Black cod and crab gyoza: Didn't expect to taste full cod and crab flavors in each bite, but both flavors came through. Excellent!Hamachi Maki: Tasty, but pretty standard. Sashimi Botan Ebi: Raw shrimp have a very particular flavor that you might not like, but these were fresh and topped with caviar. Almost $10 for each shrimp, so definitely pricey!Grilled scallop: Seared scallops are good, but these grilled scallops were unexpectedly wonderful.Grilled sea bream: Not sure what to expect, but another excellent grilled item. Salmon sashimi: Standard fresh sashimi. Yellowtail tartare: One of our favoritesIf you want a high energy restaurant with excellent sushi and asian entrees, this is the place for you. Highly recommended!Total cost was about £170 or $230, so plan for a pricey dinner, especially if you're drinking.

YBk0qLwbegfDYAf4YUH1tQ.text: Wonderful. Been living in Manhattan for the past 7 years and have been eating at top tier restaurants for a long time. Roka exceeding all of my expectations. It was so good I went back two nights in a row! Cheers !

XmDMwp-m3XPUx14fGeWtVw.text: Roka has amazing service and food - Because of this, I highly recommend this restaurant, also because it's lively but not too loud! Food:- salted edamame: 5/5- yellowtail sashimi with truffle: 5/5 amazing amazing amazing!!! I will be dreaming of this dish for years to come- o-toro (semi fatty tuna): 5/5- prawn tempura roll: 5/5- california roll: 4/5 just your average california roll- chicken skewers with spring onion: 5/5- beef filet: 5/5 extremely tender and flavourful- asparagus robata: 5/5- peanut/vanilla/chocolate sundae: 3/5 I probably won't order this again as the consistency of the chocolate is halfway between a heavy mousse and a gelato + stuck at the bottom of this jar? It felt like a random mish mash of a dessert.Service: 5/5 the waiters were all extremely attentive, constantly making sure we had enough water and getting all of our dishes, even though we were in the corner of the restaurant.Overall, I will definitely be coming back here (and hopefully sooooon)!

cQyOPyKkTXEXKg7jqhEZfg.text: My boyfriend and I stopped here for our anniversary. We left feeling well taken care of :)Food - we got the premium tasting menu and it was delicious. The starter of yellow tail sashimi and truffle oil was super delicious. The truffle oil was subtle but very tasty. I ended up using some on my ginger that came with the sashimi platter and it was very different but so good. Another hit was the seafood dumplings. Very crispy on the skins and moist on the inside. They flavored it well so it tasted like it was pork/beef but the texture was of fish. The seafood was exceptionally good tonight as we went on to the Chilean sea bass over rice. The skin was extra crispy as they panfried it while they kept the inside well cooked.The dessert at the end was such a good way to end it. So many different fruits, 3 sherbets, a rocky road kind of ice cream and a short cake. Service was fair. The server was nice and they were attentive as well as on time for plate removal. The coat check in the front was a plus too!

photos.caption: Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. Various fruit, sherbet, short cake and vanilla ice cream with chocolate/marshmallows
Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. Yellow tail with truffle oil
Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. Chilean sea bass

o3gRr4o0omoi0ri8MvisAA.text: Absolutely Fantastic Restaurant!Incredibly quick and courteous service, perfect sized portions made with nutritious and healthy ingredients. You can really taste that the food has been well taken care of. We came for lunch and had a set menu. Where you could choose the main. I have never tried better fish in my life. Everything was delicious and vegetarian options were available. The meal culminated in a large platter of dessert, the highlight of which was the chocolate Buddha.Fresh fruit, delicious cocktails, creative dishes. Need I say more? Give them a call and book your table, I promise that you won't regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. Dessert!!

gkRY5dDNkqLzOL3o1ZI8Jw.text: Fancy Japanese restaurant.  Food is excellent, but expensive. The sushi is fresh, black cod is excellent, robata is good too.  Reservation is a must otherwise good luck getting a table.

sg85CA4HndKIhRVlVmzzOQ.text: Amazing, you can taste the freshness instantly. Great service, great chefs, great looking too I might add. Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom

vG_6O2jcqHRCLnn9TBTNaA.text: We had the Tokujo premium tasting menu @rokamayfair Absolutely delicious, as usual the service the food the ambiance and the presentation was lovelyThe wagyu beef, the yellowtail, the lamb and the sashimi were simply amazing, the flavours are still playing in my mindI love the robata grill as you sit next to each other enjoy a lovely conversation and see the chefs working, the standards are high, last night I saw one of the chefs cooking wagyu beef which looked a bit like medium well done, it took him 2 secs to make a decision and cook a new one..Roka Mayfair is classy Top 3 in my list of fav restaurants in London'

photos.caption: Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. Roka Mayfair
Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. Tokujo premium tasting menu @rokamayfair Exotic fruits, robata grill

pNvXNtOF4p3TmJhhp-I2uQ.text: Food was good but just a little too salty for me and my husband. Stuffs are very friendly, they also have private room for large party. It's good for business party.

C1ofEk5bsLbx8dEji3qh0g.text: The food was very good, the service was nice , the location was nice and quiet. It is classy and the food was satisfying to all ends. It was a nice because it was out first time trying Japanese food. We were surprised because even though we ordered a lot of food the price was decent.

photos.caption: Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. Classy

DjledTF6UbQ5rl2D1DZuJg.text: One of the best places to eat in London hands down. The atmosphere is amazing. The food is even better. The iceberg lettuce salad, the tofu/mushroom appetizer and the grilled salmon! Amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom

SJ34bF5jg8hefb19oDjKhQ.text: Small portions but quick service. Really good to celebrate important dates. I recommend the ribs id you dont really are into sushi. I highly recommend the restaurant but you will need to book it beforehand as it gets very busy normally, mostly in the weekends and Fridays.

fgWp61v0J5njizadAW-ekQ.text: Fast service Salads were creatively nice and tasty Spicy tuna maki and lobster rice are worth trying

EioRJzzKX_Qpbuiq_mPZgA.text: Everything about this place is super splendid:1. Yes you pay a shiny penny - but you get an amazing food value for it (I'm talking about the brunches) between the unlimited drinks and starters2. The decor is modern and clean.. and plenty of room3. The sushi is the best I ever had in the UKThe only reason why this gets 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the crowd. Lots of rather pushy people and ridiculous amounts of happy birthday songs. It kind of ruined the atmosphere for me.

mGgRtnd_KK3_iPcF59FYMw.text: We're big fans of ROKA Soho and was excited that one opened in Mayfair.  We were in the mood for Japanese and decided to try our luck without a reservation at ROKA Mayfair on a Friday night.Food: We ordered the black cod dumplings, crispy prawn maki, eggplant salad, rock shrimp tempura, soft-shell crab maki, yakitori, baby chicken and the chicken wings.  Everything, but the maki rolls were  delicious!  The maki rolls were just ok.  Looking back I would've ordered two other cooked dishes instead.Drinks: We ordered the Ume Shu (plum) and the Twinkle cocktail.Price: 109.39 GBP for two people.Ambiance: ROKA does a great job creating a busy fun restaurant feel, but keeps it feeling classy.Service: The hostess was very friendly and told us that she would be able to seat us in 30-45 minutes without a reservation.  We waited at the bar where the bartender was very nice and attentive.  When we did get seated our server was very friendly as well.Would I go back?  Definitely.  The service is great, the ambiance is classy and the food is delicious.

EQmi0II7vJa1kYO9Q85dvg.text: I have literally eaten at some of the finest restaurants around the world.  I very seldom write reviews.Had dinner at Roka Mayfair Saturday July 30, 2016.Wow!  Have to tell you...Atmosphere is very welcoming and love the kitchen in the middle.  Super clean, stylish, restrooms are impeccable.Service was really, really good with a team of people keeping us well taken care of.Food was as good as it gets:  Sushi, Sashimi, Beef, Chicken, Veggies all excellent!  Just so close to perfection, well timed, no false notes, beautiful presentation by some amazing talented artists acting as chefs.A completely trivial service problem was handled very professionally by manager Damien Bignon, who is a fantastic person to run this incredible establishment.Don't walk - run - to Roka Mayfair.  Of course service is a day to day thing but based on my experience I just can't imagine you could be anything but thrilled!We will be going back on our next trip to London!

_8bR86Bmb4_1c6vZanCLjg.text: Wow! The food at Roka is nothing over the top but amazingly fresh & tasty. Order from al carte so you get to try dishes to your taste and not offered on the tasting menu (works out cheaper too!). The ones we tried that got thumps up around the table were: deep fried Aubergine, tuna tartare w/caviar and rock shrimp & banana puffs for dessert. Definitely a place fit for Mayfair and exceptional service!

photos.caption: Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. Banana creme puffs
Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. Beef tartare with black truffle
Photo of Roka - Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. Deep fried Aubergine

ushzm5zzm-R0XmmJhOO8Hw.text: This is my favorite local sushi and Asian fusion place. I live 2 blocks away and it's an absolute gem for me!
